intro: Calamochloe, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its striking, silver-blue foliage and spiky, blue or purple flower heads. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and full sun exposure. Its hardy nature makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Calamochloe is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand salty air and coastal conditions.
